name: Spotted Dog Irish Bread
author: Josh Lovejoy
summary: This is my family's traditional St. Patrick's Day bread. My grandmother has had this recipe for longer than I've been alive. I was SHOCKED to find out this wasn't real Irish Soda Bread, but instead more commonly known as Spotted Dog. Whatever you call it, it is unbeatable topped with a bit of butter.
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Sift flour, sugar, and baking powder together in a large bowl
Beat eggs with milk in a separate bowl
Stir egg mixture into flour mixture until moistened; batter will be very thick
Fold in raisins until thoroughly combined
Spread batter into prepared cast iron skillet
Bake in the preheated oven until bread has risen and is golden brown on top, about 1 hour
